Package chunks

Class ChunkManager

java.lang.Object
chunks.ChunkManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
public class ChunkManager extends Object implements GameVariables
ChunkManager loads and holds the chunks that will be used in the game. The chunks are basically building blocks of the level.
Since:
March 2, 2024
Author:
Nick Clouse, Andrew Denegar, Molly O'Connor
See Also:
  • Chunk

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface gameTools.GameVariables

    GameVariables.Facing, GameVariables.State

  • Field Details

    • activeChunks

      public static final Set<Chunk> activeChunks
      List of chunks currently visible on the screen.

    • xOffset

      public static int xOffset
      The x offset of the maze from it's starting position. This is public so other classes can access it, like Player and Enemy

    • yOffset

      public static int yOffset
      The y offset of the maze from it's starting position. This is public so other classes can access it, like Player and Enemy

    • FILE_LOCATION

      private static final String FILE_LOCATION
      File location, should always be in data folder.

  • Constructor Details

    • ChunkManager

      private ChunkManager()
      Constructor for ChunkManager. This is private because ChunkManager is a singleton, and only one instance of ChunkManager can exist at a time.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ChunkManager getInstance()
      Makes a new instance of ChunkManager. Chunk manager is a singleton, which means only one instance of ChunkManager can exist at a time. ChunkManager is a singleton because we only need one instance of it for our game, and don't want multiple instances to be made.
      Returns:
      The current instance of ChunkManager.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method. Used for testing.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments passed.

    • playerHit

      public static void playerHit(GameVariables.Facing d, int damage)
      When the player is hit, this function tells the current instance of ChunkManager to handle it. It's static so other classes can call it without having to use a single instance of ChunkManager.
      Parameters:
      d - The direction the player should be knocked back.
      damage - How much health the player will lose from the hit.

    • resetOffset

      public static void resetOffset()
      Resets the offset.

    • updateOffset

      public static void updateOffset(int dx, int dy)
      Update the offsets.
      Parameters:
      dx - The number to update x offset by.
      dy - The number to update y offset by.

    • checkCollision

      public boolean checkCollision(Integer[] deltas)
      Checks for collision between the player and all blocks in the current active chunks.
      Parameters:
      deltas - The change in x and y.
      Returns:
      true if there is any collision.

    • containsPlayer

      public boolean containsPlayer(Chunk c, PositionBlock pb)
      Returns true if the player is in the given block, same idea used for collisions.
      Parameters:
      c - Chunk to check for collision.
      pb - PositionBlock to check for collision.
      Returns:
      true if there is a full collision.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
      Calls each chunk to draw itself.
      Parameters:
      g2d - 2D graphics to draw on.

    • drawEnemies

      public void drawEnemies(Graphics2D g2d)
      Draws all active enemies to the screen. A enemy is considered active if it's current position is visible on the screen.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The 2D graphics to draw on.

    • endFound

      public boolean endFound()
      Checks if the end has been found.
      Returns:
      true if end has been found.

    • getActiveChunks

      public Set<Chunk> getActiveChunks()
      Return a list of the chunks that appear on the screen.
      Returns:
      The list of chunks that are visible on the screen.

    • getChunks

      public Chunk[][] getChunks()
      Gets all the chunks in the level.
      Returns:
      All chunks in the level.

    • getKnockback

      public boolean getKnockback()
      Gets knockback variable, which represents if the player is getting knocked back or not.
      Returns:
      true if the player is getting knocked back.

    • handlePlayerHit

      public void handlePlayerHit(GameVariables.Facing d, int damage)
      Handles when the player is hit by a enemy. Sets knockback to true and decides which way to knockback the player.
      Parameters:
      d - The direction to move the player.
      damage - how much health the player will lose from this hit.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Checks if the user has won the game at least one time.
      Returns:
      true if the user has won at least once.

    • knockback

      public void knockback()
      Knockback the player when knockback is set to true. If knocking back the player would result in hitting a wall, the knockback effect stops.

    • loadLevel

      public boolean loadLevel(int levelNum, int levelVersionNumber)
      Loads level from levelNum and creates a 2D array of chunks, which represent each chunk of the maze.
      Parameters:
      levelNum - the level to load.
      levelVersionNumber - the randomly selected version of the level that will be played.
      Returns:
      true If level was loaded correctly.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets ChunkManager. Sets variables like endFound and x/y offsets to their starting values, and clears Enemy lists.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Repositions maze so the player goes back to the start block.

    • setStartLocation

      public void setStartLocation()
      Sets the starting location to the start chunk.

    • stopKnockback

      public void stopKnockback()
      Stops knockback effect and resets variables.

    • updateCoords

      public void updateCoords(int dx, int dy)
      Update coordinates of all chunks, if the chunk is visible, add to active chunks.
      Parameters:
      dx - integer to change x by.
      dy - integer to change y by.

    • updateEnemies

      public void updateEnemies()
      Adds all enemies currently visible on the screen to activeEnemies Set, so they can be drawn. It then moves all enemies that are active.

    • convertToVolatile

      private VolatileImage convertToVolatile(BufferedImage originalImage)
      Convert original images to volatile images because they are going to be loaded over and over again.
      Parameters:
      originalImage - the image to be converted to volatile.
      Returns:
      VolatileImage same image, but now volatile which increases performance when drawn over and over again.

    • isVisible

      private boolean isVisible(Chunk chunk)
      Checks if the given chunk is currently visible on the screen.
      Parameters:
      chunk - The chunk to check.
      Returns:
      If chunk is currently visible on screen.
